name: St. Wulfstan of Worcester
summary: Wulfstan was Bishop of Worcester from 1062 to 1095. He was the only English bishop to retain his see after the Norman Conquest, serving under both Edward the Confessor and William the Conqueror. He was known for his piety, charity, and pastoral care. He worked to reform the clergy and combat simony. He was canonized in 1203 and is remembered as one of the great English saints of the period.
